body: $SPY $AMD $NVDA $AAPL

$AAPL ...I'm neither bearish or bullish, I just simple try to understand the big picture.... I think Apple is a great company....I was going to invest in the 5g roll out (A certain tower company) in expectations  that Christmas would be a big selling season for the latest Iphone....Then I ran across  something that suggested the  microchip shortage would possibly hamper down cell phone sells for this christmas season....is this the right way to read into this situation....By the way i'm no longer looking too deeply into cell phone towers until i'm more confident in the iphone roll out because it seems to me that there is no strong 5g roll out without strong iphone sells ...is this the big picture...."we need more microchips? Then  Apple can sell their iphones and the cell towers can finally start with this 5g rollout ??????"
Good Morning Stocktwits. Share you watchlist for this week. I will be sharing mine here $MU $TSLA $AAPL and $LGVN

$AAPL 

Guess where AAPL belongs to?

Value and Large Cap!

Yes .. it is .. so my earlier post about rate hike do not hurt AAPL. It helps AAPL a lot. 

AAPL has large position on cash, strong dividends and occasional share buybacks. 

What hurts the most at rate hike:

Growth companies like TSLA and other growth companies that have NO cash and a lot of debts.

The Piotroski-F score of $AAPL is 7.00. This indicates good health for $AAPL. https://www.chartmill.com/stock/quote/AAPL/fundamental-analysis?key=bb853040-a4ac-41c6-b549-d218d2f21b32&utm_source=stocktwits&utm_medium=FA&utm_content=AAPL&utm_campaign=social_tracking

links.title: Manchin pulls support for Biden's $1.75 trillion social spending plan
links.description: Washington - Democratic Senator Joe Manchin of West Virginia said Sunday he can no longer support President Biden's Build Back Better Act, dealing a potentially fatal blow to the $1.75 trillion tax and spending plan that includes Democrats' key domestic policy initiatives. "I cannot vote to continue with this piece of legislation.
